title: Text-to-Speech with Amazon Polly
description:
Learn more about Amazon Polly at - http://amzn.to/2wAUWqL.
Amazon Polly is a service that turns text into lifelike speech, allowing you to create applications that talk, and build entirely new categories of speech-enabled products. Amazon Polly is an Amazon AI service that uses advanced deep learning technologies to synthesize speech that sounds like a human voice. With dozens of lifelike voices across a variety of languages, you can select the ideal voice and build speech-enabled applications that work in many different countries.

title: Building Intelligent Chatbots with Amazon Lex & Amazon Polly
description:
Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2v4ZAkG
AWS offers a family of AI services that provide cloud-native Machine Learning and Deep Learning technologies allowing developers to build an entirely new generation of apps that can hear, speak, understand, and converse with application users. In this session we take a look at Amazon Polly and Amazon Lex and how we can use these services to build intelligent chatbots across social media, websites and kiosks.

Speaker: 
- Adam Larter, Developer Solutions Architect, Amazon Web Services, ANZ

title: AWS re:Invent 2017: Amazon Polly Tips and Tricks: How to Bring Your Text-to-Speech V (MCL307)
description: Although there are many ways to optimize the speech generated by Amazon Polly's text-to-speech voices, you might find it challenging to apply the most effective enhancements in each situation. Learn how you can control pronunciation, intonation, and timing for text-to-speech voices. In this session, you get a comprehensive overview of the available tools and methods available for modifying Amazon Polly speech output, including SSML tags, lexicons, and punctuation. You also get recommendations for streamlining application of these techniques. Come away with insider tips on the best speech optimization techniques to provide a more natural voice experience.

title: AWS re:Invent 2016: Introducing Amazon Polly
description:
Learn more about Amazon Polly here: http://amzn.to/2heMV31
Amazon Polly is a service that turns text into lifelike speech. Polly lets you create applications that talk, enabling you to build entirely new categories of speech-enabled products. Polly is an Amazon AI service that uses advanced deep learning technologies to synthesize speech that sounds like a human voice. Polly includes 47 lifelike voices spread across 24 languages, so you can select the ideal voice and build speech-enabled applications that work in many different countries. Amazon Polly delivers the consistently fast response times required to support real-time, interactive dialog. You can cache and save Polly’s speech audio to replay offline or redistribute. And Polly is easy to use. You simply send the text you want converted into speech to the Polly API, and Polly immediately returns the audio stream to your application so your application can play it directly or store it in a standard audio file format, such as MP3.

title: AWS Educate - Bring Your Site to Life with Amazon Polly
description:
Learn more about AWS Educate at - https://amzn.to/2Aq8DNS.
In the final show of our series, we take you through how to integrate the Amazon Polly Wordpress plugin which will enable you to easily voice your content so readers can listen to news and articles directly from your site.

The plugin also enables you to publish podcasts directly from your site and make them available for listeners who are on-the-go.

Amazon Polly is a service that allows you to convert text to lifelike speech, using the same technology that powers Amazon Alexa.

title: Live Coding with AWS | Reading Web Pages with Amazon Polly & Chrome Extensions
description:
Check out the upcoming schedule, previous recordings, and links to the resources discussed at - http://amzn.to/2BtQIqq.

Build a browser extension that reads a web page using Amazon Polly in this interactive twitch.tv/aws live coding session with Randall Hunt, Sr. Technical Evangelist. 

Amazon Polly is a service that turns text into lifelike speech, allowing you to create applications that talk, and build entirely new categories of speech-enabled products. Amazon Polly is a text-to-speech service that uses advanced deep learning technologies to synthesize speech that sounds like a human voice. With dozens of lifelike voices across a variety of languages, you can select the ideal voice and build speech-enabled applications that work in many different countries.

For more information on Amazon SageMaker, visit https://aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/.

title: Scaling FICO Customer Communication Services with Amazon Polly Text-to-Speech
description:
Learn more about Amazon Polly at - https://amzn.to/2ESniAd.
FICO Customer Communication Services (CSS) team focuses on providing automated voice, text and email communications to help organizations with fraud detection and customer service. Learn how they use Amazon Polly Text-to-Speech to power a range of voice applications to improve the customer experience.

tags: Machine learning case study NLP services
title: How Policybazaar Uses Amazon Polly to Personalize the Customer Experience
description:
Learn more about AWS Startups at - https://amzn.to/2EibytO.
Policybazaar.com is India’s leading insurance web aggregator with millions of customers nationwide who can quickly compare and purchase plans. Find out how Amazon Polly helped Policybazaar increase the voice message adoption by customer by 20%, improve customer experience and save on customer servicing costs.

title: Using Amazon Translate,  Amazon Polly, and Amazon Rekognition with .NET
description:
Learn more about AWS at – https://amzn.to/2AG2wnS
In this video, we show you how to use Amazon Translate, Amazon Polly and Amazon Rekognition in your .NET application.

title: AWS Summit Series 2017 - San Francisco: Amazon Polly Introduces a Whispered Voice Tag
description:
You can now add a whispered speech effect in your Text-to-Speech output with Amazon Polly, and support visual animations that are synchronized with speech output using Speech Marks. Try both new features through the Amazon Polly console.

Learn more at - https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/new-amazon-polly-speech-marks/

title: Amazon Polly Adds New Whispered Voice Tag, and Speech Marks for Synchronization w/Visual Animation
description:
Learn more about Amazon Polly at - http://amzn.to/2pgs2fU.
Amazon Polly is a service that turns text into lifelike speech, making it easy to add voice to your website, mobile app, or device. You can add high-quality male or female voice output to your video, presentation, or online training course, by example, with 47 lifelike voices across 24 languages.

To enhance the lifelike experience of using Amazon Polly voices, you can now easily add a whispered speech effect in your Text-to-Speech output. To create voices that mimic the effect of whispering, you simply use the SSML tag “whispered” to mark the text input to be spoken in a hushed or whispered voice. This tag can be applied to any of the 47 voices in Polly’s Text-to-Speech portfolio.

In addition to content creation, Amazon Polly now enables developers to provide speech-synchronized facial animation or karaoke-style word highlighting. Through the use of Speech Marks, you can add an enhanced visual experience to your application through synchronized speech. This is particularly useful if you have an application with an animated avatar – say, a gaming application -- which requires the ability to synchronize lips with voice, or you are using Polly in an educational environment, highlighting text for an enhanced reading experience. When used in combination with the synthesized speech audio stream, Speech Marks enables you to build applications that leverage the exact timing of when particular sentences, words and sounds are being produced, for a more engaging and animated experience when interacting with your voice-enabled application. You can try both new features through the Amazon Polly console.

title: AWS re:Invent 2016: NEW LAUNCH! Introducing Amazon Polly (MAC204)
description: This session will introduce you to Amazon Polly, a new deep learning service that turns text into lifelike speech. Polly enables existing applications to speak as a first class feature and creates the opportunity for entirely new categories of speech-enabled products – from mobile apps and cars, to devices and appliances. Polly includes 47 lifelike voices and support for 24 languages, so you can select the ideal voice and distribute your speech-enabled applications in many geographies. Polly is easy to use – you just send the text you want converted into speech to the Polly API, and Polly immediately returns the audio stream to your application so you can play it directly or store it in a standard audio file format, such as MP3. Polly supports Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML) tags like prosody so you can adjust the speech rate, pitch, or volume. Polly is a secure service that delivers all of these benefits at high scale and at low latency. You can cache and replay Polly’s generated speech at no additional cost. Polly lets you convert 5M characters per month for free during the first year. Polly’s pay-as-you-go pricing, low cost per request, and lack of restrictions on storage and reuse of voice output make it a cost-effective way to enable speech synthesis everywhere.  Join this session to learn more and find out how you get can started with Amazon Polly, today!

title: Live from the London Loft | Introducing Amazon Rekognition and Amazon Polly
description:
Visit http://amzn.to/2xMoS6H for more information on the current live coding shows, upcoming episode schedule, or for recordings of previous broadcasts. To learn more about the AWS Pop-up Loft | London, please visit https://awsloft.london/.

Host: Ian Massingham, Senior Technical Evangelist
Live from the London Loft, Senior Technical Evangelist, Ian Massingham introduces Amazon Rekognition and Amazon Polly.

title: AWS re:Invent 2017: Creating Next Generation Speech-Enabled Applications with Amazon (MCL206)
description: Amazon Polly is a service that turns text into lifelike speech, making it easy to develop applications that use high-quality speech to increase engagement and accessibility. Get a glimpse into successful applications that use Amazon Polly text-to-speech service to enable an app to talk to its users. Attendees will benefit from understanding real-world business use cases, and learn how to add feature-rich voice capabilities to their new or existing applications.

title: AWS re:Invent 2017: Building a Voice-Enabled Customer Service Chatbot Using Amazon L (MCL301)
description: Amazon Lex is a service for building conversational interfaces into any application using voice and text, and Amazon Polly is a service that turns text into lifelike speech. This session combines both of these AWS services during which the presenter will demonstrate how to build a Help Desk chatbot that feature spoken-voice interfaces. Attendees will be provided with the foundational skills for those looking to enrich their applications with natural, conversational interfaces. Liberty Mutual Insurance will also present on their chat platform architecture to demonstrated how they areusing Amazon Lex in their organization as an employee digital assistant.

title: AWS Summit Online ASEAN 2020 | Turn Text Into Lifelike Speech Using Deep Learning
description:
Turn text into lifelike speech using deep learning (Level 200 - Intermediate)
The Amazon Polly text-to-speech (TTS) service uses advanced deep learning technologies to synthesise natural-sounding human speech. In this session, learn how you can create a custom voice for the exclusive use of your organisation with Amazon Polly Brand Voice.

AWS Speaker: Sev Gassauer-Fleissner, Sr. Solutions Architect, Global

Download the slides: https://go.aws/3b0DX4H

Learn more about AWS at - https://amzn.to/2FyowH3
